cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi ESE of the Dominican Republic – southern coast
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW across the eastern-central Caribbean, then curving northwest toward Hispaniola, Jamaica and Cuba
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola near the Dominican Republic–Haiti border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Saba & Sint Eustatius northward along parts of the Dominican Republic north coast; Cayman Brac and Little Cayman
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for southern Dominican Republic coast, southern Haiti, and Jamaica; Tropical Storm Warning for parts of Haiti and southern Dominican Republic east of Punta Palenque
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward and Leeward Islands, southern Puerto Rico, southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, eastern & central Cuba, eventually the Cayman Islands and Florida Peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of gusty winds possible; chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds only 5%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected – surge confined to southern Hispaniola, Jamaica and Cuba
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with isolated 5 inch pockets possible tonight into Saturday, capable of minor flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas, increased rip-current risk across the Virgin Islands through Saturday
